results.justification: The document explicitly states the methodology, focusing on analyzing research papers from LAK conferences to understand generalisability. "we took inspiration from [10] methodology and analysed 144 full research papers..."

The document provides a detailed step-by-step description of the research process, including coding process, inter-rater reliability checks, and data analysis. "Following the coding process used by [28]..." and subsequent paragraphs detail the process.
The authors made the working sheets available via a link: "We have also made available the working sheets in this link: https://kortlink.dk/2qx3t"

The coding heuristic is explicitly listed, serving as a form of data documentation. "The full papers were downloaded and deductively and inductively coded using the following coding heuristic: (1) ... (9)"

The document clearly describes the data collection methods, specifying the conferences (LAK ’22, 23 and 24) and the type of documents collected (full research papers). "...analysed 144 full research papers from the three most recent LAK conferences..."
The document does not mention any shared code repository (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).
Since no code is shared, there are no scripts for data cleaning, analysis, or visualization included.

The document reports Fleiss’ kappa values and p-values, indicating the use of statistical methods. "The final kappa when comparing the results of the coding authors indicated a good level of agreement (^ = 0.76, subjects=154, raters= 2, and p <0.005)"

The document describes inductive coding and thematic analysis, which are qualitative methods. "Once again, the coding and theming process was informed by [28]. Both researchers coded the limitations’ section with specific attention..."
The document presents the categorization of papers (Table 1) and themes extracted (Table 2), sharing the outcomes of the analysis.

The document explicitly discusses limitations, including the scope of the selection and the lack of analysis of short papers. "[See the Limitations section for an acknowledgement of the impact of the scope of the selection]." and "Lastly, while we aimed to cover the key concepts... we may have overlooked other relevant concepts."
